content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great problem to practice working with strings and conditionals.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Perfect , the addition of 'y' in vowels will make a few people scratch their heads

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Perfect for ultra fast clash of code

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice simple clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and straightforward clash that can be solved in under 5 minutes.

- Validator 4 "Consonant" does not meet the input description of s being a lowercase string.
- Please add some test cases where the number of vowels is 0, and another set of test cases where the number of consonants is 0.
- Please add a statement in your stub generator as follows:

STATEMENT
vowels: aeiouy
read s:string(10)
write answer

This is to avoid confusion as to which characters are considered vowels, especially in Reverse mode.

Input
* Please delete "Input description".

Output
* Please delete "Output description".

Constraints
* Please change "[[len(s)]]" to "length of [[s]]".

* Please change 100 to 10 if [[s]] is 10 characters or shorter in all cases.

* Please delete the second and third constraints.

Stub generator
* Please change 100 to 10 if [[s]] is 10 characters or shorter in all cases.

* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Cases
* Please change "codingame" to "challenge" in Validator 2.

* Test 3 and Validator 3: Please change [[s]] to consist of consonants only.

* Validator 4: Please change [[s]] to consist of vowels only but different from Test 4.

* Please ensure you cover all 26 English letters in tests.

* Please ensure you cover all 26 English letters in validators.

Thanks.

Input
* Please delete "Input description".

Output
* Please delete "Output description".

Constraints
* Please add a space before "length".

Cases
* These cases have no names:
  • Test 1
  • Validator 1
  • Test 2
  • Validator 2
  • Test 3
  • Validator 3
  • Test 4
  • Validator 4
  Please add back the names above.

* Test 5: Please change [[s]] to "vfzwjxqk" to cover the remaining consonants.

* Validator 5: Please change [[s]] to "jfzqmxbkp" to cover the remaining consonants.

* Please add Test 6 with [[s]] = "eoaeay".

* Please add Validator 6 with [[s]] = "iyiuuiy".

Thanks.

Thanks I fixed the issues for the set of validator and test.
I precised Vowels are {{a,e,i,o,u,y}} in constraint instead of the stub generator since I didn't find how to write it there. Is that OK ?

"Vowels are a,e,i,o,u,y" is NOT a constraint. It's not a limitation on the types of cases the player is expected to handle. It's a rule for the task itself.

In addition, the Constraints section isn't displayed during a Reverse mode clash, so it doesn't address the issue raised by @User123.
Ok, well I delete Reverse in the list since it would be confusing either way
Ok thanks for resolving. Will approve after changes suggested by @5DN1L have been made.
Oh did I miss more changes to make ?
Please read the comments at the very bottom.
Yes, I saw it, I made the changes, thanks for your guidance.
Somehow test 5 and test 7 are the same now :/
You're right, I modified the test 5 so it won't do the same test twice.

My original intention was that, with the suggested changes, 6 pairs of cases would be sufficient to cover all the 26 letters of the English alphabet.

I'd prefer that the current Test 5 and Validator 5 be removed, since they're now redundant, and their removal would also reduce the number of invented words (e.g. "accompting" doesn't appear to be a real word). That said, this is a minor point, so it's ok to leave them in if you'd rather not adjust the cases further.

In any case, I've withdrawn my rejection of the contribution, and thank you for following up on the issues all along.

I update the cases so the set Test and the set Validator both cover all the 26 letters and verify cases for only vowels and only consonants. I hope it will be better like that. Don't hesitate to correct me on anything.
Looks good to me, thanks.
